Gropay API Documentation Introduction Welcome to the Gropay API , your gateway to seamless financial services integration. Our API provides a secure, scalable, and developer-friendly way to manage user accounts, payments, and transactions within the Gropay ecosystem. This documentation will guide you through authentication, user registration, transactions, and more . Whether you're building a fintech app, integrating payment processing, or managing user identities, our API is designed to help you move fast with confidence . Key Features User Management – Register, authenticate, and manage users securely. Payments & Transactions – Process payments, manage transactions, and track balances. Security & Compliance – Built with robust security measures, including BVN verification. Webhooks & Notifications – Get real-time updates on transactions and user actions. Getting Started To begin using the Gropay API: 1. Sign up for API access and get your credentials. 2. Authenticate using JWTs or OAuth. 3. Start integrating using the endpoints documented below.

docs.text: User Registration API Overview This API endpoint allows users to register by providing their personal details, contact information, and role. Endpoint URL: /api/v1/user/registration Method: POST Content-Type: application/json Authentication: Not required for registration Request Body The request must be in JSON format with the following fields: Field Type Required Description firstName string ✅ Yes User's first name middleName string ❌ No User's middle name (optional) lastName string ✅ Yes User's last name gender string ✅ Yes User's gender (e.g., Male, Female) phone string ✅ Yes User's phone number (e.g., 2345762296334) email string ✅ Yes User's email address password string ✅ Yes User's password (must meet security requirements) bvn string ❌ No User's Bank Verification Number (optional) permissions array<string> ✅ Yes List of permissions assigned to the user superAgentId integer ❌ No ID of the super agent, if applicable role string ✅ Yes User's role (e.g., "USER" ) Sample Request { "firstName": "John", "middleName": "Doe", "lastName": "Smith", "gender": "Male", "phone": "2345762296334", "email": "john@example.com", "password": "SecurePass123!", "bvn": "12345678901", "permissions": [ "PERMISSION_ACCOUNT_CREATE" ], "superAgentId": 10, "role": "USER" } Response The API returns a JSON response indicating the success or failure of the registration. Success Response Status Code: 201 Created { "step": "STEP_1", "nextStep": "STEP_1", "userId": 0, "email": "string", "fullName": "string", "createdDate": "string", "updatedDate": "string", "role": "string", "message": "string" } Error Responses Status Code Error Message Description 400 Bad Request Invalid input Some required fields are missing or incorrectly formatted 409 Conflict User already exists The email or phone number is already in use 500 Internal Server Error Server error An unexpected error occurred Notes Ensure that the email and phone number are unique. Password should be strong and follow security best practices. If superAgentId is provided, it must be a valid reference.
